item.title: queen latifah bonds with dolly parton over breasts
item.description: queen latifah has nothing but nice things to say about her idol, dolly parton.

item.title: earthquakes shake australia, new zealand
item.description: moderate earthquakes rattled parts of australia and new zealand on saturday, including the devastated city of christchurch where power was cut ...

item.title: kuwait cabinet quits to avoid ministers' grilling
item.description: kuwait's cabinet resigned as expected thursday to avoid a grilling by parliament of three ministers, all members of the ruling al-sabah family, amid calls for political and economic reform.

item.title: nick jonas is doing just fine on his own
item.description: the youngest jobro is branching out into writing, producing and performing onstage.

item.title: "silent" strokes less common in physically fit
item.description: people who participate in vigorous activity are less likely to experience so-called "silent" strokes, new study findings report.

item.title: vcu vexes no. 1 kansas to earn school's first trip to final four
item.description: virginia commonwealth has done the unthinkable. the rams stunned no. 1 seed kansas 71-61 in san antonio on sunday to earn the school's first-ever ...

item.title: icloud stores all info on all devices
item.description: apple stole the thunder on clouds at its worldwide developers conference in san francisco.

item.title: texas lawmakers may need special session for budget
item.description: texas lawmakers could be headed to a special legislative session as early as tuesday after a late-night filibuster on sunday delayed a bill linked to the state budget, officials said.

item.title: soccer: manchester united deflates chelsea title hopes
item.description: united needs just one more point to reclaim the premier league title after defeating chelsea, 2-1.

item.title: lindsay lohan avoids criminal charge in betty ford quarrel
item.description: prosecutors on tuesday decided against filing a battery charge against lindsay lohan that might have sent the troubled actress to jail over a confrontation at california's betty ford center rehab clinic.

item.title: anti-abortion amendments added to proposed ohio budget bill
item.description: two amendments restricting abortions in public hospitals and clinics were added to the ohio senate's proposed budget bidon tuesday, a day before lawmakers are set to vote on it.

item.title: the rail: morning line: another defection, and uncle maybe
item.description: the morning line for wednesday, may 4

item.title: palestinian dies after protest in jerusalem
item.description: a palestinian teenager who was shot during protests in jerusalem died on saturday, hospital officials said, and israeli police, expecting further demonstrations, deployed heavily in the streets.

item.title: japan stops radioactive leaks from nuclear plant
item.description: engineers stopped radioactive water leaking into the sea from the crippled plant, the facility's operator said.

item.title: final four trip pays off for coaches
item.description: college coaches love reaching the final four for more than the obvious reasons -- it can also bring them more money in bonuses.

item.title: endo to acquire american medical for $2.9 billion
item.description: the deal is the third for endo pharmaceuticals in 12 months, and will add to the drug maker's treatments for urology and pain.

item.title: u.s. to publish radiation data from airport screening
item.description: the transportation security administration said on friday it will start publishing radiation test results from airport passenger and luggage screening equipment in a bid to allay lingering fears about potential health risks.

item.title: several hundred keep up protest pressure in morocco
item.description: several hundred teachers marched through rabat on monday for better pay a day after one of morocco's largest anti-government protests in recent decades against corruption and demanding government change.

item.title: dr. irwin d. mandel, expert on dental chemistry, dies at 89
item.description: dr. mandel, a founder of the preventive dentistry movement, did research on the biochemistry of saliva that was important to many medical fields.

item.title: bp faces angry oil spill protesters at agm
item.description: bp's annual shareholder meeting was disrupted by campaigners protesting against the oil giant's role in the gulf of mexico spill, while investors registered their disapproval with big votes against directors.

item.title: children are among casualties of syrian military raids after demonstrations
item.description: human rights activists and residents in towns near homs said 42 people were killed as neighborhoods were besieged by tanks and troops.

item.title: manchester city beats stoke 3-0 in premier league
item.description: manchester city is on the verge of qualifying for the group phase of nest season's champions league after beating stoke 3-0 tuesday night, three days after defeating the same opponent in the fa cup final to end a 35-year title drought.

item.title: 40 civilians dead in tripoli strikes: vatican official
item.description: at least 40 civilians have been killed in air strikes by western forces on tripoli, the top vatican official in the libyan capital said thursday, citing what he called reliable sources in close contact with residents.

item.title: nasa sending retired space shuttles to museums
item.description: the three retiring u.s. space shuttles will be going on display at museums in florida, california and virginia, the u.s. space agency nasa said on tuesday.

item.title: google loses executive to groupon, preps rival service
item.description: online coupon service groupon has hired a google executive to be its new chief operating officer, as google began rolling out a new service aimed directly at groupon's thriving business.

item.title: al qaeda "cadres" still help afghan taliban: u.s.
item.description: fewer than 100 al qaeda members remain inside afghanistan, but they form a core group providing the afghan taliban with resources and technical battlefield skills, the second most senior u.s. commander in the country said monday.

item.title: google loses exec to groupon, preps rival service
item.description: online coupon service groupon has hired a google inc executive to be its new chief operating officer, as google began rolling out a new service aimed directly at groupon's thriving business.

item.title: donald trump driving pace car at indianapolis 500
item.description: donald trump hasn't announced whether he'll run for president, but he will be involved in a race of a different kind next month.

item.title: couture, grabner and skinner named calder trophy finalists
item.description: san jose sharks center logan couture, new york islanders winger michael grabner and carolina hurricanes center jeff skinner have been named finalists for rookie of the year, the nhl said on tuesday.

item.title: ozone layer faces record loss over arctic
item.description: the depletion of the ozone layer shielding earth from damaging ultraviolet rays has reached an unprecedented low over the arctic this spring ...

item.title: a strongman found support in prominent u.s. conservatives
item.description: laurent gbagbo, who had refused to cede presidential power before being captured, had the backing of at least one american senator and the rev. pat robertson.

item.title: yemen crisis deal collapses despite u.s. pressure
item.description: last-minute diplomatic wrangling has derailed a deal on a transition of power in yemen despite growing u.s. pressure on president ali abdullah saleh to agree to the gulf-brokered plan and relinquish power.

item.title: yemen transition deal falls through at last minute
item.description: a deal on a transition of power in yemen fell through at the last minute on wednesday, even as washington stepped up pressure on president ali abdullah saleh to sign a gulf-brokered agreement to ease him out of office.

item.title: toys r us ipo likely in july: source
item.description: toys r us is targeting an initial public offering in july, a source familiar with the matter told reuters on wednesday.

item.title: nigerians turn out for presidential vote
item.description: nigerians massed at polling stations saturday for what they hoped would be their first credible presidential election in decades.

item.description: australian open champion novak djokovic outlasted roger federer 6-3, 3-6, 6-2 to stay undefeated this season and reach the bnp paribas open final ...

item.title: berlusconi leaves hospital after attack
item.description: italian premier silvio berlusconi, his face bandaged, has left a milan hospital four days after being attacked at a political rally.

item.description: yovani gallardo was the second straight pitcher to flirt with a no-hitter at busch stadium, allowing only a single to start the eighth inning ...

item.description: alex avila homered and had a career-high five rbi to back an effective pitching performance by justin verlander as the detroit tigers ended the ...

item.title: microsoft not too late for tablet party: citigroup
item.description: microsoft is still not too late for the tablet party. and with its next operating system closer than most expect, the software maker could corner meaningful market share in 2013 and beyond, citigroup said.

item.title: webber on the pace in first spanish practice
item.description: australian mark webber lapped a second faster than world champion team mate sebastian vettel in a red bull one-two in friday's first free practice for the spanish grand prix.

item.title: roundup: rose plans to keep firing away for the bulls
item.description: the league m.v.p. said that he did not shoot too much in sunday's loss to atlanta, and that he just needed to stop missing so many.

item.title: u.s. orders transcanada to shut pipeline
item.description: after spills, the department of transportation declares that the pipeline poses a decisive threat and that corrective action is needed.

item.title: blast kills 9 at afghan base, including 5 from nato
item.description: five nato service members and at least four afghan troops were killed by a suicide bomber in an afghan national security uniform as the taliban warned it would step up its infiltration of local forces.

item.title: honoring freedom riders at an old bus station
item.description: the site of a mob attack on freedom riders in 1961 has been turned into a museum, and some of the riders returned for its dedication.

item.title: "book of mormon", "anything goes" top drama desk awards

item.title: spain 4, u.s. 0 : with more important games to come, u.s. is taught low-cost lesson
item.description: spain, the world cup champion, scored three times in 13 minutes in the first half and generally had its way in a 4-0 victory at gillette stadium.

item.title: ex-central banker warns on canada health spending
item.description: canada can't keep spending on healthcare at its current rate, and must choose between a number of unpopular options for its state-funded medical system, a former central bank chief said on wednesday.

item.title: in malaysia, shiites struggle to practice their faith
item.description: where sunni islam is the official religion, other forms of the faith, including shiite islam, are considered deviant and are not allowed to be spread.

item.title: lawrence taylor gives his side after sentencing
item.description: the former giants great said of prostitution, "i'm not saying it's right but it's the oldest profession in the world."

item.title: oil drilling off cuba raises specter of what-if
item.description: the prospect of a blowout in cuban waters may give the obama administration an incentive to open the way for emergency assistance from the united states.

item.title: tuscaloosa honors tornado victims, volunteers with vigil
item.description: more than a thousand people lit candles on wednesday night and remembered the dozens who lost their lives after a tornado roared through tuscaloosa, alabama, in april.

item.title: "shaq" wise-cracks his way into retirement
item.description: shaquille o'neal formally announced his retirement on friday, ending a professional nba career that spanned nearly two decades.

item.title: shaquille o'neal confirms retirement
item.description: shaquille o'neal formally announced his retirement friday, ending a professional career in the national basketball association that spanned nearly two decades.

item.title: does work interfere with breastfeeding?
item.description: the sooner a new mother goes back to work after giving birth, the less likely she is to breastfeed her baby, researchers have found.

item.description: unheralded virginia commonwealth has won three n.c.a.a. tournament games by a combined 49 points, going from the first four to the round of 16.

item.title: thai and cambodian troops exchange fire near ancient temple
item.description: thai and cambodia troops fought with short-range rockets and guns near 900-year-old preah vihear temple tuesday, opening a second front in a five-day confrontation that has killed 13 people in southeast asia's bloodiest border dispute in years.

item.title: cambodia pm welcomes talks after thai border clashes
item.description: cambodian prime minister hun sen offered wednesday to meet one-on-one with his thai counterpart after six days of sporadic fighting that has killed at least 14 people, raising hopes of a ceasefire in southeast asia's bloodiest border dispute in years.

item.title: analysis: on cloud 2: making fans of customers on social media
item.description: in may 2008, a blog post caught computer maker dell inc by surprise: popular tech blog gizmodo had broken news about dell's inspiron 910 mini-notebook -- months ahead of its launch -- after seeing ceo michael dell toting the notebook at an industry conference.

item.title: states move to make biking safer
item.description: more states are trying to make it safer to bicycle, as more cyclists hit the road

item.title: keeping score: which team has the right stuff to win the cup?
item.description: focusing on concepts of sports psychology like big-game experience, leadership on the ice and consistency can help determine who will win the stanley cup.

item.title: new armed services chairman is ready to be heard
item.description: representative howard p. mckeon, the new chairman of the house armed services committee, has not shied away from opposing the administration.

item.title: aflac picks new duck voice to replace gottfried
item.description: a clean-cut minnesota father of three is the new voice of insurer aflac, taking over the role of the acerbic quacking duck from the fired comedian gilbert gottfried.

item.title: feds now target execs, not just companies, in health frauds
item.description: federal enforcers are targeting individual executives in health care fraud cases that used to be aimed at their corporations.

item.title: zuckerberg says not opening facebook to under-13s
item.description: facebook is not working on opening up the world's biggest social network to children under the age of 13 in the short term, founder and chief executive mark zuckerberg said wednesday, contradicting some media reports.

item.description: patrick peterson -- a potential no. 1 overall pick in april's nfl draft -- wants to be in new york to hear his name called.

item.title: the office: sedentary no more
item.description: less physical activity at work may be a major but overlooked culprit in rising american obesity. this calls for a management solution.

item.title: la lakers survive marathon test to eclipse phoenix suns
item.description: kobe bryant delivered a sensational performance to lead the los angeles lakers to a roller-coaster 139-137 triple-overtime victory over the phoenix suns on tuesday.

item.title: u.s. chases elusive currency-detection technology
item.description: to combat money laundering and contain the drug war raging along the u.s.-mexico border, u.s. authorities are seeking technology to detect the hoards of cash that smugglers try to spirit abroad.

item.description: sometimes scientific research can be a lousy job.

item.title: novartis vaccine shields against meningitis cause
item.description: novartis ag's bexsero vaccine helps protect toddlers against the most common cause of meningitis when used as a booster, the swiss drugmaker said on thursday, giving its meningitis franchise another lift.

item.title: u.s. nuclear investment to pause: analysts
item.description: plans for nuclear power investment in the united states will be sidelined but not derailed by the problems japan is having with the fukushima nuclear plant, experts said in a panel discussion on thursday.

item.title: u.s. markets calm as greece weighs on europe
item.description: stocks fell in europe, pressured by financials, as investors sold riskier assets after talks on a revised bailout package for greece.

item.title: royals legend paul splittorff dies at 64

item.title: honda, mazda to resume some production

item.description: the former u.s. telephone monopoly is pursuing a potentially lucrative strategy abroad, offering one-stop service to multinational companies.

item.description: spending more on transportation -- and spending it wisely -- would create jobs and improve the nation's competitiveness, an economist writes.

item.title: creating plays, but holding on to the day job

item.description: the obama administration, under criticism for its treatment of the u.s. soldier accused of leaking secret documents that appeared on the wikileaks website, is transferring the detainee to a kansas jail.

item.title: long-term costs next challenge for f-35 jet program
item.description: the pentagon's next challenge in the $382 billion lockheed martin corp f-35 fighter program will be cutting longer-term operating and maintenance costs and keeping unit production costs low.

item.description: as a former "american idol" judge, singer, songwriter and producer, kara dioguardi, made her mark offering no-nonsense feedback to contestants hoping for stardom on the popular singing talent contest.

item.title: bnp's bumper q1 sets high bar for rivals
item.description: bnp paribas, france's biggest listed bank, beat first-quarter forecasts, driven by strong retail growth and resilient investment banking that bolstered investor confidence and set a high bar for rivals.
